intro: Acetosa heterophyla, commonly known as the variable sorrel, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible leaves. The plant is characterized by its alternate, palmately lobed leaves that can vary in shape, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Acetosa heterophyla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
